about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: You should always travel:
hasPart.assesses: You should always travel: | You should always travel: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: The speed at which you should drive your vehicle depends on road conditions, the weather, and the legal speed limit. You may never drive above the legal speed limit. Decrease your speed when anything makes conditions less than ideal.

suggestedAnswer.text: At the speed of vehicles surrounding you.

comment.text: At the speed of vehicles surrounding you.
At the speed limit.

suggestedAnswer.text: At a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.

comment.text: At a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.

acceptedAnswer.text: At a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.

comment.text: At a speed appropriate for road and weather conditions.

answerExplanation.text: The speed at which you should drive your vehicle depends on road conditions, the weather, and the legal speed limit. You may never drive above the legal speed limit. Decrease your speed when anything makes conditions less than ideal.

comment.text: You should always travel: | The speed at which you should drive your vehicle depends on road conditions, the weather, and the legal speed limit. You may never drive above the legal speed limit. Decrease your speed when anything makes conditions less than ideal.

hasPart.name: This sign means:

hasPart.text: A round sign always indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing.

comment.text: Stop sign ahead.
Railroad crossing ahead.
Construction ahead.
Railroad crossing ahead.

answerExplanation.text: A round sign always indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing.

comment.text: This sign means: | A round sign always indicates that you are approaching a railroad crossing.

hasPart.name: When turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, you should:

about.name: When turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, you should:

hasPart.assesses: When turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, you should: | When turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When making any turn, turn from the lane closest to the direction you wish to travel into the first available legal lane. On a turn from a two-way to a one-way street, this means you should turn into the first lane.

comment.text: Turn into any lane.
Turn into first lane.
Turn into second lane.
Turn into first lane.

answerExplanation.text: When making any turn, turn from the lane closest to the direction you wish to travel into the first available legal lane. On a turn from a two-way to a one-way street, this means you should turn into the first lane.

comment.text: When turning left from a two-way street onto a one-way street, you should: | When making any turn, turn from the lane closest to the direction you wish to travel into the first available legal lane. On a turn from a two-way to a one-way street, this means you should turn into the first lane.

hasPart.name: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:

about.name: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should:

hasPart.assesses: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should: | You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You should always slow down before entering a curve. You may not be able to see hazards ahead and braking in a curve may cause your vehicle to skid.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.

comment.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.

comment.text: Slow to the posted speed limit for the freeway.

suggestedAnswer.text: Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.

comment.text: Wait until you have entered the curve to begin braking.

acceptedAnswer.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.

comment.text: Slow to a safe speed before the curve.

answerExplanation.text: You should always slow down before entering a curve. You may not be able to see hazards ahead and braking in a curve may cause your vehicle to skid.

comment.text: You exit the freeway on a ramp that curves downhill. You should: | You should always slow down before entering a curve. You may not be able to see hazards ahead and braking in a curve may cause your vehicle to skid.

hasPart.name: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate?

about.name: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate? | Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: You should always signal when moving your vehicle to the right or left. On an interstate, you should stay in the right lane if you are moving more slowly than the surrounding traffic. It is illegal to back up or make a U-turn on interstate highways, so if you miss your exit, you should proceed to the next exit.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slower traffic must keep to the right.

comment.text: Slower traffic must keep to the right.
Change lanes without signaling.

suggestedAnswer.text: If you miss your exit, you must go to the next exit.

comment.text: If you miss your exit, you must go to the next exit.
Change lanes without signaling.

answerExplanation.text: You should always signal when moving your vehicle to the right or left. On an interstate, you should stay in the right lane if you are moving more slowly than the surrounding traffic. It is illegal to back up or make a U-turn on interstate highways, so if you miss your exit, you should proceed to the next exit.

comment.text: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate? | You should always signal when moving your vehicle to the right or left. On an interstate, you should stay in the right lane if you are moving more slowly than the surrounding traffic. It is illegal to back up or make a U-turn on interstate highways, so if you miss your exit, you should proceed to the next exit.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: Which of the following is not a safe driving practice when driving on the interstate?

hasPart.name: Which of these is a safe driving technique?

about.name: Which of these is a safe driving technique?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these is a safe driving technique? | Which of these is a safe driving technique? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

suggestedAnswer.text: Using your high beam lights in the fog.

comment.text: Using your high beam lights in the fog.

suggestedAnswer.text: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.

comment.text: Staring at the road ahead of your vehicle.
Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.
Checking your rearview mirrors frequently.

answerExplanation.text: To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

comment.text: Which of these is a safe driving technique? | To stay aware of hazards, you should scan the road and check your rearview mirrors every two to five seconds. Constantly staring at just the road ahead of you is dangerous. If you must drive in foggy conditions, you should use your low beam headlights, not your high beam headlights.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which of these is a safe driving technique? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: Which of these is a safe driving technique?
